Containers.Name: binhex-delugevpn
Containers.Description: [b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Description[/span][/u][/b][br] Deluge is a full-featured ​BitTorrent client for Linux, OS X, Unix and Windows. It uses ​libtorrent in its backend and features multiple user-interfaces including: GTK+, web and console. It has been designed using the client server model with a daemon process that handles all the bittorrent activity. The Deluge daemon is able to run on headless machines with the user-interfaces being able to connect remotely from any platform.[br][br] [b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Configuration[/span][/u][/b][br] [b]/config[/b] This is where deluge will store it's configuration file, database and logs.[br] [b]/data[/b] This is where deluge will store data downloaded, watched folder, and archived torrents.[br][br] [b][span style='color: #E80000;']Note[/span][/b] This Docker includes OpenVPN to tunnel all traffic securely, please set the environment variables "VPN_USER" and "VPN_PASS" to your VPN credentials. The environment variable VPN_REMOTE and VPN_PORT allows you to define the host you want the tunnel connected to, e.g. nl.privateinternetaccess.com (default), sweden.privateinternetaccess.com, uk-london.privateinternetaccess.com. The environment variable VPN_PROV can be "pia" or "custom", this Docker also includes Privoxy which can be used to bypass ISP filtering of index sites, simply point at "host ip:8118".
